item.title: 银行股接近创纪录水平，回购和股息增长指日可待
item.description: 美国银行股升至三年来的最高水平，原因是投资者继续涌入银行集团，猜测这些银行在上周轻松通过美联储的压力测试后，将开始增加回购和分红。【原文：US bank stocks rose to their highest level in three years as investors continued to pile into the group amid speculation they will begin to boost buybacks and dividends after the lenders comfortably cleared the Federal Reserve’s stress test last week.】

item.title: 机器人初创公司从美国和中国风险投资公司获得 1.05 亿美元种子资金
item.description: Genesis AI 是一家开发机器人软件的初创公司，它在一轮融资中筹集了 1.05 亿美元，支持者既有美国人也有中国人。【原文：Genesis AI, a startup working on software for robots, has raised $105 million in a funding round with both US and Chinese backers — a rarity in an industry split along geopolitical lines.】

item.title: 泛欧交易所称正在洽谈收购雅典证券交易所事宜
item.description: 泛欧交易所（Euronext NV）表示，它正在洽谈收购雅典股票市场运营商，并称此举将有助于希腊资本市场融入欧元区，并加强其国际发展。【原文：Euronext NV said it is in talks to buy the Athens stock markets operator, a move it says would help integrate Greek capital markets into the Eurozone and increase their international development.】

item.title: 花旗银行认为，如果铜价与其他货币恢复挂钩，赞比亚克瓦查将继续反弹
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc）表示，如果赞比亚货币与铜价的相关性得以恢复，赞比亚货币似乎将持续走高。【原文：Zambia’s currency appears set for sustained gains if its correlation with the copper price is restored, Citigroup Inc said.】

item.title: 英国央行行长贝利称英国债务低迷令高利率效果大打折扣
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）表示，由于英国企业和消费者的债务水平较低，高利率对通货膨胀的影响较小。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said high interest rates are having less of an impact on inflation because of Britain’s low levels of debt among both businesses and consumers.】

item.title: 空中客车公司称 6 月份将交付约 60 架飞机，低于目标值
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，空中客车公司 6 月份交付了约 60 架飞机，这要求这家欧洲飞机制造商在下半年提高产量，以实现全年目标。【原文：Airbus SE delivered about 60 aircraft in June, people familiar with the matter said, requiring the European planemaker to step up output in the second half of the year to achieve its full-year target.】

item.title: 日本央行上田仍需更多信息才能决定下一次加息
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫进一步表示，他将等待更多数据来对下一次货币政策决定做出判断，这表明他并不急于提高借贷成本。【原文：Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda ramped up his message that he is going to wait for additional data to make a judgment on the next monetary policy decision, signaling that he’s in no rush to raise borrowing costs.】

item.title: 欧洲央行怀疑欧元涨势是否会由祝福变为诅咒
item.description: 欧洲中央银行官员开始担心，欧元的快速升值可能会破坏将通胀率固定在 2% 的努力。【原文：European Central Bank officials are starting to fret that a rapid appreciation of the euro could derail efforts to anchor inflation at 2%.】

item.title: 韩国央行行长 Rhee 称关税对经济增长的打击仍是政策问题
item.description: 韩国央行行长李昌镛（Rhee Chang-yong）表示，韩国央行仍然关注关税对经济扩张而非通胀的影响，并正在判断如何继续降息，同时权衡稳定风险。【原文：The Bank of Korea remains concerned at the tariff impact on economic expansion rather than inflation and is judging how to keep cutting interest rates while weighing stability risks, according to Governor Rhee Chang-yong.】

item.title: 一位方正合伙人因新帕泰克债务交易在德国受审
item.description: 金融咨询公司 One Square Advisors 的一名合伙人是在慕尼黑受审的一群人中的一员，他被控欺诈一家德国纺织公司的债券持有人 100 万欧元（120 万美元）。【原文：A partner of financial advisory firm One Square Advisors is among a group of people standing trial in Munich accused of defrauding bondholders of a German textile company out of €1 million ($1.2 million).】

item.title: 前瑞穗债券交易员因欺骗行为申请解除英国禁令失败
item.description: 前瑞穗国际有限公司（Mizuho International Plc）政府债券交易员三人组被英国金融监管机构指控滥用市场，但他们在挑战金融服务禁令的诉讼中败诉。【原文：A trio of ex-Mizuho International Plc government bond traders accused by the UK’s City watchdog of market abuse lost their bid to challenge their ban from financial services.】

item.title: 电子商务公司 Jumia 吸引了 Axian 的收购兴趣
item.description: 据知情人士透露，非洲最大的电子商务公司 Jumia Technologies AG 已引起电信公司 Axian Telecom 的收购兴趣。【原文：Jumia Technologies AG, the biggest e-commerce company in Africa, has drawn takeover interest from telecommunications company Axian Telecom, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 俄罗斯原油出货量接近两个月低点
item.description:
较小港口出口量的减少抵消了两个主要码头流量的增加

。【原文：

Lower exports from smaller ports offset increased flows from two key terminals

】

item.title: 监管机构命令瑞士报价减少可疑活动
item.description: 瑞士金融监管机构加大了对交易平台 Swissquote Group Holding SA 的压力，要求其采取更多措施遏制可疑活动，因为欺诈和黑客攻击未遂事件激增。【原文：Switzerland’s financial watchdog has stepped up pressure on trading platform Swissquote Group Holding SA to do more to curb suspicious activity amid a surge in attempted fraud and hacks.】

item.title: 美国职位空缺意外升至11月以来最高点
item.description: 美国 5 月份的职位空缺出乎意料地增至 11 月份以来的最高水平，这主要是受休闲和酒店业的推动，裁员人数也有所减少，表明尽管经济存在不确定性，但劳动力市场依然稳定。【原文：US job openings unexpectedly rose in May to the highest level since November, largely fueled by leisure and hospitality, and layoffs declined, pointing to a stable labor market despite economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 美国 6 月制造业活动连续第四个月萎缩
item.description: 由于订单和就业萎缩速度加快，6 月份美国工厂活动连续第四个月萎缩，制造业萎靡不振的局面得以延续。【原文：US factory activity contracted in June for a fourth consecutive month as orders and employment shrank at a faster pace, extending the malaise in manufacturing.】

item.title: 印度反垄断机构将在格拉西姆公司抗议后调查亚洲涂料公司
item.description: 印度反垄断监管机构已下令对亚洲涂料有限公司展开调查，因为后起之秀格拉西姆工业有限公司（Grasim Industries Ltd.）指控该行业领导者滥用其支配地位，加剧了当地涂料行业约 80 亿美元的地盘争夺战。【原文：India’s antitrust regulator has ordered an investigation against Asian Paints Ltd. after upstart Grasim Industries Ltd. alleged the sector leader was abusing its dominant position, intensifying turf war in the roughly $8 billion local paints sector.】

item.title: 鲍威尔称今年夏天关税将对美国物价产生影响
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔表示，他预计关税的影响将在未来几个月的通胀数据中显现出来，同时也承认不确定性依然存在。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said he expects the impact of tariffs to show up in inflation data in coming months, while acknowledging that uncertainties remain.】

item.title: 卢拉呼吁巴西最高法院维持增税计划
item.description: 巴西政府将向最高法院提出上诉，试图挽救被国会推翻的一项有争议的税收法令，从而使总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦与立法者之间就政府为加强预算所做努力的斗争升级。【原文：Brazil’s government will appeal to the Supreme Court to try to save a controversial tax decree overturned by Congress, escalating a fight between President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva and lawmakers over the administration’s efforts to shore up its budget.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯债务市场首次场外交易吸引 5.33 亿美元资金
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯推出主权里亚尔债券场外结算后，新的债务交易活动开始活跃起来，以努力发展王国的资本市场，吸引更多的外国投资者。【原文：Saudi Arabia is seeing fresh debt trading activity after launching over-the-counter settlement for sovereign riyal bonds in an effort to develop the kingdom’s capital markets and draw more foreign investors.】

item.title: 参议院努力通过特朗普税收法案，美股涨势暂停
item.description: 美国股市在连续两天创下收盘纪录并创下 2023 年以来的最佳季度表现后，稍作喘息。【原文：US stocks took a breather after two straight days of closing at a record and notching the best quarter since 2023.】

item.title: 据说投资者撤单后，德国医疗技术公司搁置 IPO
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，医疗技术公司Brainlab周二推迟了在法兰克福的首次公开募股，原因是一些投资者撤回了订单，这是在欧洲新股市场持续低迷的情况下被搁置的最新一笔交易。【原文：Medical technology company Brainlab postponed its initial public offering in Frankfurt on Tuesday after some investors withdrew their orders, according to people familiar with the matter, the latest deal to be shelved as Europe’s market for new listings remains subdued.】

item.title: 安娜-保尔森就任费城联储主席
item.description: 安娜-保尔森周二就任费城联邦储备银行首位女行长，此前她在芝加哥联储工作了二十多年。【原文：Anna Paulson takes over Tuesday as the first female president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia, after over two decades on the staff of the Chicago Fed.】

item.title: 欧洲央行在债券价格下滑时仍持有世界线债券
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（European Central Bank）持有陷入困境的支付公司 Worldline SA 的两笔债券，而在新闻报道称该公司掩盖其部分客户的欺诈行为后，债券价格出现下滑。【原文：The European Central Bank held on to two bonds of embattled payments company Worldline SA while prices slumped following news reports alleging that the company covered up fraud by some of its customers.】

item.title: 丹麦央行敦促贷款人增加借贷，缓解市场利率压力
item.description: 丹麦中央银行希望当地贷款机构利用更多的一周贷款，为客户提供更多现金，以帮助降低短期利率。【原文：Denmark’s central bank wants local lenders to tap more of its one-week loans and provide added cash to clients to help reduce short-term interest rates.】

item.title: 联合信贷银行将为部分客户提供贝莱德比特币 ETF 挂钩产品
item.description: 意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit SpA）将向其专业客户提供一种与贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：UniCredit SpA will offer its professional clients a structured product tied to BlackRock Inc.’s iShares Bitcoin Trust ETF that features full protection against losses, as European banks seek new ways to tap into appetite for digital assets.】

item.title: 微软与英超联赛签订协议，为其人工智能工具提供支持
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp. ）已与英超联赛（Premier League）签署了一项云计算协议，该协议将使这家软件公司能够向体育迷们兜售其人工智能技术。【原文：Microsoft Corp. has signed a cloud computing deal with the Premier League, a pact that will let the software company tout its AI technology to a captive audience of sports fans.】

item.title: 捷克克朗创年内新高，行业鹰派论调加剧
item.description: 捷克克朗兑欧元汇率升至一年多来的最强水平，原因是一项衡量工业活动的指标超出预期，支持了捷克央行对进一步降息的谨慎态度。【原文：The Czech koruna gained to the strongest level against the euro in more than a year as a gauge of industrial activity beat expectations and supported the central bank’s cautious approach to further interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 智利经济活动下滑，支持削减关键利率
item.description: 智利 5 月份的经济活动因多个行业的下滑而意外减少，这支持了智利央行在未来几个季度再次降息的前景。【原文：Chile’s economic activity unexpectedly dropped in May on declines across several sectors, supporting the central bank’s outlook for renewed interest rate cuts over the coming quarters.】
